sub_title: Project Manager - BioMerieux - Advancing the Fight Against Antibiotic Resistance - Patient Safety/Quality Professional
summary: Project Management and Healthcare Business Administration professional with a primary focus in Patient Safety and Healthcare Quality ~ working to advance Antimicrobial Stewardship, awareness, and training in the fight against sepsis, antimicrobial resistance, and antibiotic overuse - Combining and leveraging Business, Project Management, and clinical data/information privacy expertise. Katheryn is a results-driven, people-focused, and extremely versatile professional with 20+ years of comprehensive training and transferrable talents - collaborating on cross-functional teams to provide sustainable and exceptional deliverables while performing process improvement work. Advanced project leadership abilities with strong expertise in the healthcare, robotics, life sciences, education, and clinical research sectors. Additional abilities in non-profit and professional services. Proven problem-solving and customer facing abilities. Continual learner dedicated to leading the development and implementation of company goals and business strategies. Thrives under pressure and can adapt quickly to changes. Expertise in team leadership and collaboration, with college level training in Meeting Management and Calendar and time Management.

profile_positions.description: Project Manager - BioMerieux, US Integrated Solutions Group- Managing the deployment of CLARION Advanced Analytics SaaS - A robust suite of analytics dashboards for Hospital Microbiology and Molecular Biology Laboratories. Optimizes efficiency and outcomes with data-driven, infectious disease management. CLARION provides a holistic view of relevant lab and clinical data across departments, processes, and vendors and translates this data into actionable insights visualized on easy-to-use dashboards.

volunteer_experiences.description: “ Bridges Hospice strives to empower their patients, families and caregivers with the tools, education and support needed to make informed decisions during the last phases of life. The physical, emotional and spiritual needs of our patients are met through an individualized, ethical plan of care focused on the patient and their family.” ~ Bridges Hospice
